sourceMeaningMnemonic: Standing on your <radical>roof</radical>, you're <radical>certain</radical> that the nearby <radical>mountain</radical> is shrouded in <kanji>secrecy</kanji>. But you can't do much about it, stuck on your roof as you are. So much secrecy, but so far away.
meaningInfo: Really feel the frustration of wanting to uncover all the secrecy around this mountain but being stuck on your stupid roof.
readingMnemonic: This <kanji>secrecy</kanji> is so secret that the people who know about it wear magical <reading>mitts</reading> (<ja>みつ</ja>) of secrecy that make it so we can't tell anyone, no matter what.
readingInfo: You can imagine trying to break one of the mitts-wearing members of this group, but they can't tell you anything because of their magical mitts.
